body:
Customized TV Listings are available here: 
 www.latimes.com/tvtimes
Click here to download
 TV listings for the week of Sept. 20 - 26, 2015 in PDF format 
 This week's TV Movies
 
SERIES
Cedar Cove
 Olivia (Andie MacDowell) is baffled and hurt when Paul (Colin Ferguson) decides to leave Cedar Cove and refuses to explain his decision to her in the season finale. Dylan Neal, Sarah Smyth and Jesse Hutch also star. 8 p.m. Hallmark
Doctor Who
 The Doctor (Peter Capaldi) is trapped with no companion in a Dalek city without his sonic screwdriver or the TARDIS in the conclusion of this two-part episode. 9 p.m. BBC America
Blunt Talk
 When Walter's (Patrick Stewart) estranged son (played by Daniel Stewart, Patrick's real-life son) comes to Los Angeles for a boxing match, Walter wants to make peace with him. Celia (Dolly Wells) gets pulled into the family drama that ensues in this new episode. 9 and 10 p.m. Starz
America's Next Weatherman
 In the season finale, one of the final three weathercasters will win cash, an agent and a guest appearance in a weather segment on CNN's "Good Day." With KTLA news anchor Michaela Pereira. 11 p.m. TBS
SPECIALS
Brian Regan: Live From Radio City Music Hall
 The veteran comic stars in Comedy Central's first live comedy special, performing before a crowd at the iconic New York venue. 9 p.m. Comedy Central
MOVIES
Unbroken
 Angelina Jolie directs this adaptation of Laura Hillenbrand's fact-inspired book about Louis Zamperini (Jack O'Connell), an Olympian who survived the shooting down of his World War II bomber and became a prisoner in a succession of Japanese POW camps. Domhnall Gleeson, Finn Wittrock, Garrett Hedlund and Jai Courtney also star. 8 p.m. HBO
Murder in Mexico
 Colin Egglesfield ("Rizzoli & Isles") stars in this new 2015 TV drama as Bruce Beresford-Redman, a producer on the reality TV show "Survivor," who takes his family on a 2010 vacation to Cancun. After Monica is found strangled to death, however, he soon becomes the prime suspect for detectives. Leonor Varela also stars. 8 p.m. Lifetime
Love on the Air
 Alison Sweeney stars in this new TV movie set in the world of radio shock jocks. Jonathan Scarfe, Crystal Balint, David Lewis and Vincent Gale also star. 9 p.m. Hallmark
WEEKEND TALK
SATURDAY
Today
 (N) 6 a.m. KNBC
Good Morning America
 (N) 7 a.m. KABC
McLaughlin Group
 (N) 6:30 p.m. KCET
SUNDAY
Today
 (N) 6 a.m. KNBC
Good Morning America
 Pope Francis' vist to the U.S. (N) 6 a.m. KABC
State of the Union With Jake Tapper
 Papal visit; politics: House minority leader Rep. Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco). Papal visit; politics: Democratic presidential candidate Gov. Martin O'Malley (D-Md.). Papal visit: Mayor Michael Nutter (D-Philadelphia). Politics: Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson. Papal visit: Father Edward Beck; John Allen; Delia Gallagher; Father James Martin. Panel: Paul Begala; Ana Navarro; Van Jones. (N) 6, 8 and 9 a.m. CNN
CBS News Sunday Morning
 Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan; St. Patrick's Cathedral. (N) 6:30 a.m. KCBS
Fox News Sunday With Chris Wallace
 Republican presidential candidate former Gov. Jeb Bush (R-Fla.). Potential government shutdown: Rep. Tom Cole (R-Okla.); Rep. Mick Mulvaney (R-S.C.). Panel: George Will; Anne Gearan, the Washington Post; Michael Needham; Juan Williams. (N) 7 a.m. KTTV; 11 a.m. FNC
Fareed Zakaria GPS
 Iran nuclear deal; presidential election; email controversy; Donald Trump and the GOP; Syria; Russia and Ukraine: President Bill Clinton. (N) 7 and 10 a.m. CNN
Face the Nation
 Speaker of the House Rep. John Boehner (R-Ohio). Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.); Republican presidential candidate Gov. John Kasich (R-Ohio). Panel: Kimberley Strassel, the Wall Street Journal; Susan Page, USA Today; Nancy Cordes; Ed O'Keefe, the Washington Post. (N) 8 a.m. KCBS
Meet the Press
 Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. Republican presidential candidate Carly Fiorina. The Pope's visit: Papal biographer George Weigel. Panel: David Brooks; Andrea Mitchell; Eugene Robinson; Andrew Ross Sorkin. (N) 8 a.m. KNBC; 11 p.m. MSNBC
This Week 
(N) 8 a.m. KABC
MediaBuzz
 (N) 8 a.m. FNC
60 Minutes
 (Season premiere) (N) 7 p.m. KCBS
